##Please note that we now recommend campers use their Campsite‚Äôs Facebook group for chatting instead of their campsite‚Äôs Gitter chatroom. 
We are doing this because few of our Campsite Gitter chatroooms have active synchronous discussions, and about 1/3rd of conversations consist of someone saying ‚Äúhello‚Äù and not getting a response. Most of the discussions are asynchronous, which Facebook posts and group messages are better suited for.
We‚Äôve removed this Gitter room from our Campsite directory. Still, we will keep it open for archival purposes, and you can keep using it if you‚Äôd like.
Here‚Äôs a short blog post about how our Campsites are evolving and growing: http://blog.freecodecamp.com/2015/09/jump-start-your-local-campsite-with-coffee-and-code.html

Hello D/FW.  I recently started FreeCodeCamp to supplement some other studying.  Hope everyone is well!

@13lucky13 I don't think the algorithms are tough in terms of JS, but they are meant to get you thinking from a developer's perspective. This is tricky because computer languages require much more clarity than human languages.
ok
Wow, yeah A Smarter Way... has tons of good reviews on Amazon. Will keep that one in mind.
Everyone recommends eloquent javascript.  I am using "A smarter way to learn javascript"
If you need help on a specific exercise I might be able to provide some tips, though I'm not any kind of a javascript expert. Maybe one day!
ok thanks
Not sure how well that serves as an intro to programming in general.
Seems like everyone recommends Javascript: The Good Parts, which I have yet to read. :smile:

Yeah I only made it through that part because I have some prior coding experience. It seems unlikely that most people could solve those exercises relying purely on the knowledge presented in the Basic Javascript section.
CodeAcademy was helping, but even that was not advanced enough.   What are you using?
I agree.  I am using outside sources to beef up.

Anyone ever have problems  with the  Basic Algorithm Scripting  part?  I don't feel as though I was taught enough in the previous problems to fix the code.  Even searching and reading doesn't make it click for me.
Welcome and good luck!
